newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Tin miner Norminco says out of receivership.
newsitem.headline: Tin miner Norminco says out of receivership.

text.p: Australian tin miner Norminco Ltd said on Monday it was now out of receivership and expected to announce later this week whether the suspension of trading in its shares would be lifted.
Norminco company secretary Gordon Strickland told Reuters that Norminco "is out of receivership."
"The receiver has retired and the day to day control has reverted to the directors," Strickland said.
A lifting of the suspension on Norminco's shares depends on an Australian Stock Exchange examination of Norminco's outstanding reports which had been lodged, Strickland said.
An announcement was due later this week, he said.
Norminco went into receivership and its shares were suspended in Jaunary after operational problems at its Leichhardt Creek alluvial tin mine in North Queensland.
Its shares last traded at 17 cents on January 14.
